Sentence: Python is an interpreted interactive object-oriented programming language.
Label: S

Sentence: The Python Software Foundation is an independent non-profit organization that holds the copyright on Python versions 2.1 and newer.
Label: S

Sentence: You can do anything you want with the source as long as you leave the copyrights in and display those copyrights in any documentation about Python that you produce.
Label: S

Sentence: I had a number of gripes about the ABC language but also liked many of its features. It was impossible to extend the ABC language (or its implementation) to remedy my complaints - in fact its lack of extensibility was one of its biggest problems.
Label: S

Sentence: Python is a high-level general-purpose programming language that can be applied to many different classes of problems.
Label: S

Sentence: Python versions are numbered A.B.C or A.B. A is the major version number - it is only incremented for really major changes in the language.
Label: S

Sentence: The latest Python source distribution is always available from python.org at https://www.python.org/downloads/.
Label: S

Sentence: The standard documentation for the current stable version of Python is available at https://docs.python.org/3/.
Label: S

Sentence: Consult the Beginner's Guide to find information for beginning Python programmers including lists of tutorials.
Label: S

Sentence: There is a newsgroup comp.lang.python and a mailing list: python-list.
Label: S

Sentence: Alpha and beta releases are available from https://www.python.org/downloads/.
Label: S

Sentence: To report a bug or submit a patch please use the Roundup installation at https://bugs.python.org/.
Label: S

Sentence: It's probably best to cite your favorite book about Python.
Label: S

Sentence: See the python.org wiki at https://wiki.python.org/moin/PythonBooks for a list of books.
Label: S

Sentence: The Python project's infrastructure is located all over the world.
Label: S

Sentence: When he began implementing Python Guido van Rossum was also reading the published scripts from Monty Python's Flying Circus which is a BBC comedy series from the 1970s.
Label: S
